title: Granja del Cerdo XC and Single Speed Race
description:
Granja Del Cerdo 2nd Edition Cross Country Mountain Bike Race
Saturday July 18th. Races start at 11am sharp!
course: 5 mile laps mostly on single track.  Rolling terrain, short steep climbs and descents.
registration: $25 on-site race day registration only.  Registration open 8am-10am.  Gift for first $50 registered TBA.
notes:
Food and beverages will be available to purchase on-site.  Pig themed enthusiasm with be rewarded.  Porky the pig-nata is rumored to make an appearance.  
Awards will be given to 1st-3rd of each category.  Prize of merchandise and/or cash pay out not to exceed $50 in each category.  All USAC cycling rules apply.  USAC Permit Pending.  USAC Official TBA.
directions: Travel north out of Kalispell on US Hwy 93.  Turn west on Reserve Dr.  Travel approx 3 miles west.  Turn north on Farm to Market Rd.  Travel approx 5 miles north.  Park in a dirt parking lot located on the south east corner of Kuhns Rd and Farm to Market Rd.  Registration is located approx 1/16 of a mile north of the parking area on the west side of Farm to Market Rd.

title: Opportunity State TT
directions: Take I-90 to the Opportunity exit. Follow signs to course.

title: Herron Park XC
course: The race and registration will be held at Herron Park, south of Kalispell, Montana. The course is a combination of double-track and single-track, with the main loop being approximately 5 miles long.
registration: Registration is from 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM at Herron Park; the race will begin at 11:00 AM. Registration $20 - Juniors racing in Junior category -free.  Juniors racing in categories other than Juniors - $20.  One day license will be available - $5.  All Pro and Cat 1 racers must have an annual license.  All USAC rules apply.
notes: There will be a free kids race, following the main race.  Racing starts at 11:00 AM.  Promoters have the right to combine classes.  Prizes for all categories - Prizes must be collected at Awards Ceremony (no winnings will be mailed).  50% of all proceeds will be donate to the Foys to Blacktail trails organization.  Race Official:  Don Russell
directions: From Hwy 93 :  Turn onto Rocky Cliff Road, which is about 3 miles south of the main part of Kalispell.  Turn left at Airport Road (Rocky Cliff ends there).  Airport road name changes to Foys Canyon Rd (same road).  Stay on Foys Canyon about 2.5 miles to Herron Park.

title: Montana Middle School/High School State Championsh
Woodland Cross
description: The race will be held at Woodland City Park in Kalispell on the 17th of October.
course: The course is mix of grass, asphalt, rock, hard pack single track and some stairs.
registration:
$20 race day registration; open 
8:30-10:15am.  Juniors who are MBRA members - race free.  USAC license required.  
Cat 4 men and women without a 2009 annual license must purchase a one-day license 
for $10. All other categories must have an annual license.  Promoters reserve the right 
to combine classes.
notes: 10:45 race - Race Meeting. No single category payout will exceed $499.
directions:
From Hwy 93 turn East onto Hwy 2 for 1 mile, turn Right onto Woodland Park Drive for 
.25 miles, turn right at Woodland Park
